definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The poor boy was named during a streetcar strike in New Orleans in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 窮小子在1929年新奧爾良公車罷工期間得名。

sentences.english: How does bracket fungus get its name?
How did woodpeckers get their name?
The disease gets its name from streaks of yellow and white that discolor the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 這個病疫得名於它會使玉米的葉子褪色，變成黃白色。

sentences.english: The invertebrate takes itsname from the equally flashy terrestrial anemone flower.
sentences.chinese: 它和陸地生物銀蓮花一樣，得名於它的華麗。

sentences.english: Hubei province, located in the middle of the borderland referred to in dongting lake and hubei.
sentences.chinese: 湖北簡稱，地處我國中部，以居洞庭湖北而得名。

sentences.english: Rizhao, a place that gets the sunshine first.
sentences.chinese: 日照因朝陽先照而得名。

sentences.english: Paradox is named owing to the contradictory of expression, but it does not militate against understanding.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾表達因表達存在矛盾而得名，但它不妨礙理解。

sentences.english: In fact the entire species in named for it’s tail.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個物種就是因爲尾巴而得名的。

sentences.english: Golden Orb Weaver Spider Spiders in this group are known for the golden sheen of their silk.
sentences.chinese: 金球織網蜘蛛這類蜘蛛以發光的金絲得名。

sentences.english: The nebula was named after its resemblance to a dumbbell when seen in visible light.
sentences.chinese: 該星雲因在可見光下觀測其形似啞鈴而由此得名。

sentences.english: As a clan of being skilled in sericulture, Can Cong clan was named after silkworm.
sentences.chinese: 蠶叢氏作爲擅長養蠶制絲的部族，即以蠶而得名。

sentences.english: There are many other ideas on how the cake originally got its name.
sentences.chinese: 關於這種蛋糕最初因何得名說法不一。

sentences.english: Big banyan tree:Rongjiang county is famous for great quantities of old Banyan trees.
sentences.chinese: 大榕樹》榕江縣城因爲有很多古老的榕樹而得名。

sentences.english: "Haicai Tune" of the Yi Nationality got its name from a sea-vegetable in Yilong Lake.
sentences.chinese: 石屏彝族“海菜腔”是從異龍湖中的海菜而得名的。

sentences.english: In the past, there were nine Tibetan villages inhabitting the ravine, so that is why it is called “Nine-Village Ravine”.
sentences.chinese: 過去，溝中有九個藏族村寨，因此得名。

definition: ... hence the name (used at the end of a sentence)
to pass on/to hand down/tradition has it that .../according to legend
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
old term/old way of referring to sth
also known as/alternative name/to also be called
also known as/alternative name/to also be called
